option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
# Data Migration Summary
## Extracted Hardcoded Data
All hardcoded data from the React components has been successfully extracted and exported to JSON files:
### 1. Navigation Data (`/src/data/navigation.json`) - Header navigation items (Overview, Monitoring, Alerts, Analytics) - Icon mappings for each navigation item
### 2. User Profile Data (`/src/data/user.json`) - User information (Forest Ranger) - Application branding (Forester app name and description) - Avatar and logo styling configurations
### 3. Sensor Data (`/src/data/sensors.json`) - 4 monitoring sensors with coordinates, types, values, and status - Sensor type definitions with icons and units - Temperature, humidity, air quality, and wind speed sensors
### 4. Forest Data (`/src/data/forests.json`) - 4 national forests with boundaries, areas, and health status - Yellowstone, Olympic, Sequoia, and Redwood national forests - Geographic boundary coordinates for map rendering
### 5. Alert Data (`/src/data/alerts.json`) - Active alerts with locations, severity levels, and messages - Alert type definitions and classifications - Fire risk, deforestation, and pest activity alerts
### 6. Analytics Data (`/src/data/analytics.json`) - Analytics zones for visualization on maps - Growth rate zones and monitoring areas - Zone-specific metrics and descriptions
### 7. Statistics Data (`/src/data/stats.json`) - Overview, monitoring, alerts, and analytics statistics - Performance metrics and health scores
## Components Updated
### 1. `InteractiveMap.tsx` - Now imports sensor, alert, forest, and analytics data from JSON files - Removed hardcoded arrays for sensors, alerts, and forest boundaries - Uses dynamic data rendering for all map elements
### 2. `Header.tsx` - Imports navigation items from navigation.json - Uses user and app data from user.json - Dynamic icon rendering based on JSON configuration
### 3. `Sidebar.tsx` - **STATS OVERLAY FUNCTIONALITY COMPLETELY REMOVED** - Now only displays forest selection interface - Uses forest data from forests.json - Clean, streamlined interface without statistics
### 4. `page.tsx` (Main Dashboard) - **REMOVED StatsOverlay component import and rendering** - Simplified layout focusing on map and forest selection
## Stats Overlay Removal
The stats overlay functionality has been completely removed from: - Main dashboard page (no StatsOverlay component) - Sidebar component (no stats display) - All associated statistics rendering logic
The application now has a clean, data-driven architecture with all hardcoded values externalized to JSON files, making it easy to modify data without touching the component code.
